intro: Schwaegrichenia, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Schwaegrichenia has small, scale-like leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions.
